etymologies: Old English ōra ‘unwrought metal’, of West Germanic origin; influenced in form by Old English ār ‘bronze’ (related to Latin aes ‘crude metal, bronze’)

definitions: a naturally occurring solid material from which a metal or valuable mineral can be profitably extracted

examples.text: a good deposit of lead-bearing ores

shortDefinitions: naturally occurring solid material from which metal or valuable mineral can be extracted profitably
